description: First pass of intellectual genealogy analysis: extracts main ideas, narratives, bifurcations, and theoretical positions from the current work. These become the target ideas whose genealogy will be traced through the author's prior works.
researcher_question: What are the core ideas, theoretical positions, and conceptual bifurcations in this work?

ideas.idea_name: string - concise name for this idea
ideas.description: string - what the idea claims or asserts
related_ideas: string - other idea_ids that this idea depends on or connects to

textual_evidence.quote: string - direct quote from the text

ideas.analytical_function: string - what role this idea plays in the overall argument

narrative_structure.main_thesis: string - the central argument of the work
key_bifurcations: string - where the argument splits into distinct paths or alternatives
enabling_assumptions: string - what must be true for the argument to work

key_findings: string - notable observations about the idea landscape

extraction.core_question: What are the core ideas in this work whose intellectual genealogy we should trace?
extraction_steps: SCAN FOR THEORETICAL POSITIONS: Identify explicit theoretical claims and positions the author takes
IDENTIFY KEY BIFURCATIONS: Find where the argument splits into distinct paths or alternatives (e.g., Benanav's functional economy vs. free sector split)
MAP CONCEPTUAL DEPENDENCIES: Note which ideas depend on or enable other ideas
NOTE METHODOLOGICAL COMMITMENTS: Identify the methods and analytical frameworks the author commits to
EXTRACT NARRATIVE CLAIMS: Find the story the author tells about how things are or should be
ASSESS CENTRALITY: Determine which ideas are core to the argument vs. supporting or peripheral
DOCUMENT ENABLING ASSUMPTIONS: What must the reader accept for the argument to work?

key_fields.idea_id: Unique identifier for cross-referencing across passes
key_fields.type: Classification of what kind of idea this is
key_fields.centrality: How important this idea is to the overall argument

extraction.special_instructions: Be thorough but selective. Focus on ideas substantial enough to have a genealogy â€” not every minor claim, but every idea that represents a real intellectual position. Pay special attention to ideas that seem to carry the weight of the argument or that make distinctive claims the author might have developed over time.

consolidation_rules: Merge overlapping ideas into their most precise formulation
Ensure each idea is distinct enough to trace independently
Rank by centrality to the overall argument
Flag ideas that seem derivative of other ideas in the list

id_examples.to: Functional Economy (core theoretical position on post-capitalist production)

concretization.naming_guidance: Use idea name with type and centrality level
